instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00928 (only shows battery low on screen)  need schematics
threads.message:
I assume this is because my charger is too small?   It came with no boot.  Figured out that the Touch-bar is shorted and if removed allows the machine to get 20v.
now it switches to 20v and but displays "Low battery" on screen and does not boot.  Just cycles that. 

I am pretty new to these boards.

threads.title: 820-00928 (only shows battery low on screen)  need schematics
threads.message: If you aren't using an OEM 87 Watt USBC, it won't charge.

threads.title: 820-00928 (only shows battery low on screen)  need schematics
820-00928 (only shows battery low on screen)  need schematics
threads.message:
I was not using the 85w I was using a 60w  It now boots.
I am on to a much bigger problem.   The cause of the the machine failure was the touch ID button was shorted out.  I have the button on the bench and see corrosion on the back switch.  I want to tear it apart but would like input form someone who has been there before me.

threads.title: 820-00928 (only shows battery low on screen)  need schematics
threads.message: I am closing this thread.  Starting a new one to focus just on the Touch ID button
